none: Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music (Contributor)
Northwestern University Video Cassette Collection--Northwestern University Marching Band Highlights
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
Williams, John, 1932- Olympic fanfare and theme
Hayes, Isaac. Shaft. Theme from Shaft
Cohan, George M. (George Michael), 1878-1942. Little Johnny Jones. Yankee Doodle boy

Highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's performances during the 1983-1988 seasons. Highlights begin with the Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Michigan Wolverines on October 15, 1983 in Ann Arbor, Michigan. The pregame performances include "Hail To the Victors," "She Works Hard For the Money," "Go U Northwestern." The halftime show includes performances of "Run Back to Mama," "Boy From New York City," and "Give My Regards to Broadway." Highlights continue with the October 22, 1983 Homecoming game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. Pregame performances include "Minnesota Rouser," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Pregame performances from the October 20, 1984 game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers in Minneapolis, Minnesota include "Minnesota Rouser," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." The halftime show is a salute to heroes and includes "Olympic Fanfare," a performance of Mr. Touchdown, and the theme from "Shaft." Pregame performances from the October 27, 1984 Homecoming game against the Purdue Boilermakers include "Hail Purdue" and "Wildcat Fantasy." Dale Lonis conducts the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern" is performed. Highlights from the October 5, 1985 game against the Indiana Hoosiers in Bloomington, Indiana include pregame performances of "Indiana, Our Indiana," "Wildcat Fantasy," and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "Yankee Doodle Production" and "Sing, Sing, Sing." Pregame performances from the October 12, 1985 Homecoming game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers include "Minnesota Rouser," "Wildcat Fantasy," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Pregame performances from the November 8, 1986 game against the Ohio State Buckeyes in Columbus, Ohio include "Buckeye Battle Cry" and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "Big Noise From Winnetka" and "Groovin' Hard." Pregame performances from the October 12, 1986 Homecoming game against the Wisconsin Badgers include "On, Wisconsin," "America the Beautiful," the National Anthem, "Malague√±a," and "Go U Northwestern." Pregame performances from the October 10, 1987 game against the Minnesota Golden Gophers include "Minnesota Rouser," the National Anthem, and "Go U Northwestern." Halftime performances include "El Gato Triste." The highlights conclude with the halftime show from the November 7, 1987 game against the Iowa Hawkeyes. Performances include "Temptation," "Sir Gawain and the Green Knight," and "Countess of Monte Cristo." John P. Paynter conducts "Alma Mater."

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
